events.message: The insured filed a claim reporting a car accident that occurred on February 28th at a busy intersection.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to vehicle collision details.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to assist the claimant with the next steps and documentation needed.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the claimant of timely assistance.
The claimant was requested to submit photographs of the damaged vehicle and the police report related to the accident.
The claimant submitted all required documents including vehicle damage photos and an official police report.
An investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and verifying details of the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the claimant was not at fault in the accident.
A settlement amount covering repair costs and rental car expenses was proposed to the claimant.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the claims handling process and clear communication from the agent.
The claim was formally approved following acceptance of the proposed settlement by the claimant.
Payment was issued to cover the authorized repair work and ancillary expenses as agreed upon.
The claim case was closed following completion of payment and confirmation of vehicle repairs.
All case files and correspondence related to this auto accident claim have been archived for future reference.
